intro: Boesenbergia oligosperma, commonly known as the lesser galangal, is a rhizomatous herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, followed by dark brown, spiky fruits. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications due to their distinctive flavor and medicinal properties. Boesenbergia oligosperma thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
